reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just come back from a short break in Florence, staying at the Relais Il Campanile and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great place for a great price. The location was excellent, just a minute's walk from the Duomo and only a 10 minute walk from Santa Maria Novella train station. The staff were really helpful and friendly - as soon as we arrived Paolo got a map out and showed us the best places to visit and to eat and he also helped us to find out train times for our trip back to the airport. The breakfast in your room was a nice touch and we appreciated being able to choose the time that it was served (up to 10am) as you want to be able to relax on holiday. The room was clean, the bed was very big and comfy and the bathroom was good with a great shower. The air conditioning worked fine, although the 'off' button seemed to be broken so we had to leave it on all the time, which seemed a bit of a waste. Otherwise, everything was great and made for a wonderful, relaxing holiday.
reviews.title: Great place, great staff.

reviews.text: We got lost initially when we got of the train but quickly got directions and made our way to our pensione. It was about a block and a half from the Duomo.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

likes.liked: — Nice breakfast served in the room. Air conditioning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once you entered the street doorway, you walked up about two flights of stairs before you reached the Relais Campanille office where we were staying. Our room was then another flight up the stairs from that. Above us, on what would have been the fourth floor, was another pensione. It is not uncommon in Europe to have your pensione located inside a building with other businesses or other pensiones. If you are staying at a place like this, you want to be clear about how many flights of stairs you will be walking up. We consider ourselves in alright shape and we had booked this room before I had torn my meniscus. My knee held up pretty well even with all the steps. (One thing I have noticed is that overall, generally, Europeans seem to be in much better physical shape than Americans. They definately do more walking and stair climbing).
reviews.title: Fabulous Place to Stay

likes.disliked: — Ask Sara for directions to Mario's for lunch!

reviews.text: The room was quite a welcome difference from the one in Venice. It has a tile floor, big amoir, desk, t.v. that works (although only one totally English speaking channel, SKYTV, which is like cnn- and also there was an mtv style music channel with a mix of contemporary Italian groups and English speaking groups). We were ecstatic to find air conditioning. This bathroom was bigger, you could actually turn around in the shower, and there seemed to be plenty of hot water.
reviews.title: A Great place to stay
Excellent B&B!
reviews.text: We initially had a problem with the toilet and called down the office. The young woman that had checked us it told us that the manager was away right now but she would call him and he would come and fix the toilet. It is interesting to note that the manager is not at the pensione twenty-four hours a day. When the office closes in the early evening, there is no manager on the premises. This was not a problem for us but some people may not be comfortable in a foreign country staying in a place where the manager leaves in the evening.

We stayed at the Relais Il Campanile in May 2006. Sara was friendly and helpful during our stay, she even booked the Uffizi and Accademia for us prior to our arrival. The rooms were clean and made up everyday. The private washroom was very clean but very tiny, you need to maneuver, but not a problem. The air was not on yet but it never got too hot in May and you can open the windows, which when shut was completely soundproof. This is a high tourist location, less than a block from the Duomo and the 2-3 blocks from the Accademia. The best part was the warm breakfast brought to our room every morning with selections of cappuccino/hot chocolate, orange/grapefruit juice, warm/cold milk, hot roll, croissants, crackers, cookies and several jams and nutella. This is a b&b and not a hotel so there is nobody at the reception in the evening. Also, you may need to carry your own luggage up the flight of stairs to the reception on the 2nd floor.
reviews.title: Great location, great service!
Great location, staff, room
reviews.text: We stayed at the Relais in Florence for 2 nights. I booked a room online for a great price. I had wanted to stay closer to the train station, but the location of the hotel turned out to be perfect. It was not even a 2 minute walk to the Duomo. I would estimate the walk from the train station to the hotel at about 10-15minutes. The hotel is also less than five minutes by foot to the Accademia.

reviews.title: Not so sure about the Relais II Campanile
reviews.text: Our room was very spacious and very clean. The bathroom was also very clean. The staff was SUPERB. They were extremely friendly and helpful. We got great recommendations on sightseeing, shopping and restaurants.

reviews.title: Gorgeous place, wonderful staff
reviews.text: The icing on the cake was the breakfast, which was delivered to our room each morning at the time that we chose.
Overall, it was an excellent stay. I only wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Best budget stay in Florence

reviews.text: For the price we paid, we found this B&B to offer great value. Located a few steps from the Duomo and a block away from Galleria dell'Accademia, Relais Campanile offered us a private bathroom, air conditioning, safety box, hair dryer, a pot to make our own coffee and tea and a mini-fridge as well as a a nice size breakfast served via room service!
reviews.title: Americans should learn the value of dollars!
Sara, our hostess was wonderful.
reviews.text: The bathroom was clean and small, the room was very big for this kind of establishment, very clean and quiet (we faced the street but had no noise problems).

reviews.title: Great for the Price
reviews.text: Our hostest, Sara, was very friendly and accomodating. She acted as our Concierge as well, giving us a lot of good advice from places to see to where to eat.
It took 15 min to walk to it from the train station and we did have to carry our luggage one flight of stairs - but this is expected at most if not all inexpensive B&Bs.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location, Helpful Staff AND breakfast room service!

reviews.text: On business trips I stay at Ritz Carltons and the likes, as a tourist on a budget, we chose this B&B and we got a lot of value for the VERY low room rate.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, bad room, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One cannot beat the location and the helpfulness of the staff . The room was clean and rather basic which complements the room rate. The stairs are steep so one has to be sure they can physically get their luggage up to their room if the staff is unavailable to help. I am objectively surprised that this was not mentioned in previous reviews.There is no elavator which is not all that unusual for old buildings in europe but it should be a consideration, especially for older travellers.
reviews.title: Adequate, good deal but better be in good physical shape

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful 3 week vacation to Italy and Portugal. Our vacation began with a family wedding in Lerici, Italy then we were off to Florence to see the sites. When we arrived at Relais we were greeted by Sara who provided friendly service, and great recommendations on local sites and restaurants.
reviews.title: We loved Reais Il Campanile

likes.liked: — Convenient location and good continental breakfast

reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to the Duomo, Central Market and train station. The room was clean and comfortable, but my favorite part of our stay was breakfast delivered each morning! Delicious cappucino, juices, cereals and a variety of pastries.
reviews.title: Fantastic Bed & Breakfast
